channel.title: Support packages on Seleniumドキュメント
channel.description: Recent content in Support packages on Seleniumドキュメント

item.title: Browser navigation
item.description: ページは英語から日本語へ訳されています。 日本語は話せますか？プルリクエストをして翻訳を手伝ってください! There are commands for various webpage loading actions: Java Python C# Ruby JavaScript Kotlin // Navigate to a URL (both of the statements below are // functionally equivalent). driver.get("https://www.google.com"); driver.navigate().to("https://www.google.com"); // Go forward one page in the browser (if you're not on the // last page that was viewed). driver.navigate().forward(); // Go back one page in the browser (if you're not on the // first page that was viewed).

item.title: Working with colours
item.description: ページは英語から日本語へ訳されています。 日本語は話せますか？プルリクエストをして翻訳を手伝ってください! You will occasionally want to validate the colour of something as part of your tests; the problem is that colour definitions on the web are not constant. Would it not be nice if there was an easy way to compare a HEX representation of a colour with a RGB representation of a colour, or a RGBA representation of a colour with a HSLA representation of a colour?

item.title: Working with select elements
item.description: ページは英語から日本語へ訳されています。 日本語は話せますか？プルリクエストをして翻訳を手伝ってください! Select elements can require quite a bit of boiler plate code to automate. To reduce this and make your tests cleaner, there is a Select class in the Selenium support package. To use it, you will need the following import statement: Java Python C# Ruby JavaScript Kotlin import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.Select; from selenium.webdriver.support.select import Select // We don't have a C# code sample yet - Help us out and raise a PR include Selenium::WebDriver::Support // We don't have a JavaScript code sample yet - Help us out and raise a PR import org.

item.title: Mouse and keyboard actions in detail
item.description: ページは英語から日本語へ訳されています。 日本語は話せますか？プルリクエストをして翻訳を手伝ってください! Suppose you have an arbitrary web element e: Java Python C# Ruby JavaScript Kotlin WebElement e = driver.findElement(By.id("testElement")); e = driver.find_element_by_id("testElement") // We don't have a C# code sample yet - Help us out and raise a PR # We don't have a Ruby code sample yet - Help us out and raise a PR // We don't have a JavaScript code sample yet - Help us out and raise a PR val element = driver.
